SELECT e.emp_no AS empNo, e.name AS empName, (SELECT name FROM jobs WHERE job_no = e.job_no) AS jobName, (SELECT name FROM positions WHERE posi_no = e.posi_no) AS posiName FROM employees e WHERE e.dept_no = #{deptNo}
AND e.emp_no <> (SELECT mgr_no FROM departments WHERE dept_no = #{deptNo})

SELECT e.emp_no AS empNo, e.name AS empName, (SELECT name FROM jobs WHERE job_no = e.job_no) AS jobName, (SELECT name FROM positions WHERE posi_no = e.posi_no) AS posiName FROM employees e JOIN departments dept ON e.emp_no = dept.mgr_no AND dept.dept_no = #{deptNo}
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM EMPLOYEES WHERE dept_no = #{deptNo}

SELECT level, d.dept_no AS deptNo, d.name AS deptName, d.parent_dept_no AS parentDeptNo, (SELECT COUNT(e.emp_no) FROM EMPLOYEES e WHERE e.dept_no = d.dept_no) AS empCnt FROM DEPARTMENTS d START WITH d.parent_dept_no = 0 CONNECT BY PRIOR d.dept_no = d.parent_dept_no ORDER BY d.dept_no

SELECT d.dept_no, d.name AS deptName, e.name AS mgrName, e.emp_no AS mgrNo, e.img, (SELECT name FROM positions WHERE posi_no = e.posi_no) AS posiName, d.parent_dept_no, LEVEL FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.MGR_NO = e.EMP_NO START WITH d.parent_dept_no = 0 CONNECT BY PRIOR d.dept_no = d.parent_dept_no ORDER SIBLINGS BY d.dept_no

SELECT e.name AS empName , (SELECT name FROM positions WHERE posi_no = e.posi_no) AS posiName , (SELECT name FROM jobs WHERE job_no = e.job_no) AS jobName , e.img , e.emp_no , e.info , e.tel , e.email FROM employees e WHERE e.DEPT_NO = #{deptNo}
AND e.emp_no <> (SELECT mgr_no FROM departments WHERE dept_no = #{deptNo})
